A sculptor uses a constant volume of modeling clay to form a cylinder with a large height and a relatively small radius. The clay is molded in such a way that the height of the clay increases as the radius decreases, but it retains its cylindrical shape. At time <math alttext="t equals c"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the height of the clay is 8 inches, the radius of the clay is 3 inches, and the radius of the clay is decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="one half"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> inch per minute. (a) At time <math alttext="t equals c"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, at what rate is the area of the circular cross section of the clay decreasing with respect to time? Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.
